most_active_tickets.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
Workstream activities tab is not working
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.0.0 Performance and Stability Issues
common_issues.description: Users report performance degradation and instability with Pieces OS 12.0.0 across different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux).  Symptoms include Chrome freezing on large webpages with LTM 2.5 enabled, slow or unresponsive "New chats" feature, and application freezing during initialization.  Potential solutions include disabling LTM 2.5, checking LLM model compatibility, and reverting to a previous Pieces OS version.

related_issues.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
related_issues.text:
LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When browsing webpages with large amounts of content and dynamic elements, Chrome freezes when Pieces OS with LTM 2.5 is active. 

[Culprit webpage (Clarity CRM API Docs)](https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document) is ~500 KB raw HTML, ~700 KB total page size. Dynamic element(s) are a scroll linked table of contents.

**What happens:**

* Chrome CPU usage spikes (~50% CPU) during scrolling.
* Memory usage stays stable.
* Chrome freezes for 10-15 seconds, unfreezes, and freezes again when scrolling resumes.
* Disabling LTM 2.5 resolves the freeze (Pieces OS still running).

**Expected:**
Pieces should handle large pages without freezing or jumping while scrolling.

---

### **Steps to Reproduce**

1. Enable LTM 2.5 in Pieces OS 
2. Load a large page (https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document).
3. Scroll through the page.
4. Observe Chrome freeze / become unresponsive as Pieces tries to capture context.
---

### **Environment**

* OS: Windows 11 Pro
* Chrome: 137.0.7151.104
* Pieces OS: 12.0.0
* LTM Version: 2.5
* Pieces Chrome Extension: Tested with and without--same result. 

---

### **Additional Notes**

I observed high-frequency DOM mutations via MutationObserver, but unsure if root cause (found 80-150 DOM mutations per scroll event)

related_issues.title: Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Version 4.2.0 (4.2.0)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been using Pieces for many months and it has been an absolute timesaver. 

Over the last few weeks, 'New chats' have become increasingly slow, often taking many minutes to get the first response.  This week, it is not responding at all, and failing with the error message: 
"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

I have attempted this with and without LTM enabled and have tried different LLM models - Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Clause 3.5 Sonnect, GPT-4o.    This has not resolved things.

I have independently run the same request with GPT-4o in the browser and the request response is very rapid, so the issue appears to be with the Pieces App, rather than with the LLM
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Workstream Summary and Activities Tab Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Workstream functionality, including failure to generate summaries and update activities.  Error messages indicate potential connection issues, model access problems, and discrepancies between local and server data.  Check server status, model permissions, and data synchronization processes. Ensure Pieces OS version compatibility and consider network connectivity issues.

related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Cloud Service Interruption and Performance Degradation
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing slow performance and unresponsiveness in PiecesOS, Desktop App, and plugins, especially with cloud-connected features like Copilot, Workstream summaries, and snippet functionalities.  A service interruption is being investigated, potentially related to cloud services or a cyber incident. Data security is not believed to be impacted.  The Pieces team is working on restoring full functionality.

related_issues.title: 🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
related_issues.text:
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
We are currently experiencing a service interruption affecting several cloud-connected features across PiecesOS, the Desktop App, and Pieces Plugins. Specifically, users may notice degraded performance or unresponsiveness in the following areas:

- Copilot responses
- Workstream summaries
- Other cloud-assisted functionalities, such as snippet transforms and snippet discovery

The interruption is tied to unexpected issues with specific cloud services, and we are also actively investigating the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of our root cause analysis.

We want to reassure all users that your data security and privacy are not impacted. As a precaution, our security and infrastructure teams are treating this with the highest level of urgency and diligence. We are taking all necessary steps to investigate and remediate the issue.

Our engineering and security teams are working around the clock to restore full functionality. We’ll continue to provide updates in this thread as we learn more and make progress.

You can track the status of this interruption here and we’ll notify you once normal service has resumed.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have urgent concerns or need support, please reach out via our usual support channels.

The Pieces Team
No comments found on this issue.

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces OS 12.0.0 performance and stability issues as they affect multiple operating systems and core functionalities like LTM and "New chats".
Investigate and address the Workstream issues related to summary generation and activity updates, focusing on server status, model permissions, and data synchronization.
Address the ongoing service interruption impacting cloud-connected features like Copilot and Workstream summaries, potentially caused by cloud service issues or a cyber incident.
Monitor and update users on the service interruption, reassuring them about data security and providing estimated restoration timelines.
Allocate resources to promptly resolve the most active tickets (754, 751, 755, 753, 752, 756) to minimize user disruption and improve satisfaction.
Consider providing temporary workarounds or mitigation steps for affected users while permanent fixes are being implemented.
Review and improve error handling and messaging within the application to provide more informative and actionable error messages to users.
Enhance communication channels with users to keep them informed about ongoing issues, resolutions, and planned maintenance activities.
Collect additional diagnostic information from affected users to aid in debugging and root cause analysis of reported issues.
Proactively monitor system performance and stability to identify and address potential issues before they escalate and impact a wider user base.
Implement automated testing and quality assurance processes to prevent regressions and ensure the stability of future releases.
Review and update the support documentation and knowledge base with information about known issues, workarounds, and troubleshooting steps.
Provide training to support staff on common issues and troubleshooting techniques to improve their efficiency and effectiveness.
Analyze support ticket trends and patterns to identify recurring issues and areas for improvement in the product or support processes.
Gather user feedback on the support experience and use it to identify areas for improvement and enhance customer satisfaction.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for support response times and resolution times to manage user expectations and ensure timely support.

Use support ticket data to inform product development and prioritize bug fixes and feature enhancements that address user needs and pain points.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team, encouraging feedback, learning, and innovation to enhance the overall support experience.
Explore the use of automation and AI-powered tools to streamline support processes, such as automated ticket routing, chatbots, and knowledge base integration.
Regularly review and update support processes and procedures to ensure they are aligned with best practices and industry standards.
Consider implementing a customer satisfaction survey to measure the effectiveness of support operations and identify areas for improvement.
Establish clear escalation paths for complex or critical issues to ensure that they are handled by the appropriate personnel in a timely manner.
Provide regular reports on support metrics, such as ticket volume, resolution time, and customer satisfaction, to track performance and identify trends.

Provide regular updates to users on the status of ongoing incidents and estimated restoration times.
Conduct post-incident reviews to identify lessons learned and implement corrective actions to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.
Maintain a knowledge base of known issues, workarounds, and troubleshooting steps to facilitate self-service support and reduce ticket volume.
Make the knowledge base easily accessible to users through the product website, support portal, or other relevant channels.
Encourage users to utilize the knowledge base before submitting a support ticket to reduce the burden on the support team.
Provide feedback mechanisms for users to suggest improvements to the knowledge base and ensure that it remains relevant and up-to-date.
Use analytics to track knowledge base usage and identify areas for improvement in content, organization, and accessibility.
Consider implementing a community forum or other online platform for users to connect with each other, share tips and best practices, and provide peer-to-peer support.
